head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #31

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #31 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy Hired Transport at anchor in Michilimakinac roads, in the month of October 1813.

Fore part of this day frequent snow storms, wind at North and blows fresh at times, recd 10 Bus: Indian corn on board part provisions of the corn, latter part of the day wind and weather the same – at 8 PM set the watch[.]

Fore part of this day bafling winds from the Westward with flying clouds, clear weather, loosed the Jibbs, top sails T: G: sails & main sail to thaw & dry – at 1 PM handed them wind encreas[ed] with snow squals from WSW at ½ past 2 recd instructions from Capt Bullock to proceed to St Maries & winter with the vessel, at 4 wind SW & commences snowing, which continues at 8 wind SSW & blows fresh still drifting very much, paid out the long service – set the watch, at 11 the wind encreases to a gale from the WSW let go the small bower with about a small1/3/smallof the cable[.]

First part of this 24 hours blows very strong from the Westward, at day light moderates hove up the small bower & shortened of the best bower single reefed the top sails, at 20 minutes past 8 AM weighed from Makinac for St Joseph[s] previous to which hoisted the boat in, set T: G: sails & square sail at 10 set single reefed M: sail & whole M: T: sail, course E by N, wind at WNW blows fresh at times, cloudy smoky weather, at 11 reefed M: T: sail wind encreases & hauls more ahead, at noon wind at NW with a snow squall the detour bearing NE distant abou[t] 3 miles handed the S: S: & T: G: sails, at 40 minutes part noon enter the deto[ur] shook the reef out of the main sail & main top sail, took in square sail booms, at ½ past 3 PM cam[e] to inside Frying pan Island in 9 fathom water with the best bower, handed sails, latter part wind at N[.]
the weather looks more settled, but very cold

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
